title: Keen 4 mod: The Keys of Krodacia
content:
Here it is, the first full length keen 4 mod entitled: "'The Universe is Toast' Episode 7: The Keys of Krodacia".

[url=http://www.keengrid.net/ckfiles/modifications/Keen7.zip]www.keengrid.net/ckfiles/.../Keen7.zip[/url]

Ive been working on this mod since the release of Modkeen 2, and a lot of people have helped out with ideas, patches, and other things. Thanks everybody! Im interested in everyones comments about it, especialy on how I can improve since I'll be working on a keen 6 mod next(not for at least a few months though). Tell me what you like, what you hate, and let me know about any bugs you find. Have fun playing! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: Keen 4 mod: The Keys of Krodacia
content:
I made this topic sticky, the world's first complete Keen 4 mod deserves attention! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]

And.. WOAH!!!!! This mod is so creative and good looking that I'll go insane!! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-garg.gif[/img] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-mortlol.gif[/img] I've played now about 1/4 of it.. I love it!

Gonna play some more now.. I'll update TGMM with pictures later tonight.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Re: Keen 4 mod: The Keys of Krodacia
content:
Congratulations on having the first second generation Keen engine mod (I wish K6 simply remained part of a second trilogy; much easier to talk about that way).
Also congratulations on having accomplished what you did! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Truthfully I only played a couple of levels, but with the core Keen 4 gameplay and the added changes, it was quite fun so far.
It looks pretty different from the other games, and the changed enemies also add to it, though I have to admit the bouncing guy was annoying.

His pattern is even easier than what I'm used to, but I kept waiting too long, then wanting to go at the wrong time, waiting again, but having lost track of my count, almost going at the wrong time again, needing to pause and stop thinking about what I'm used to for a second, and pass him. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
So, he was annoying in a good way, don't worry!

Like I said, only a few levels, so no more comments from me for now.Retodon8

title: keen 7 mod!
content:
noob question here,
How can I get this to run under dosbox? If I click the keen7 batch file normally, the mod loads up and everything, but of course there's no sound or music (looks great so far, by the way). If I try running the same batch file in dosbox, I just get the message 'ck4patch KEEN4.PAT,' and I really don't know how to do any of the patching with the ck4patch exe or anything. If I try running the keen4e that came in the zip file with dosbox, I get stuck on the 'Loading... Please Wait,' and it just stays like that.
I'd really appreciate some assistance!

title: Re: keen 7 mod!
content:
Thanks everyone for the comments.

Kudos: The mod should run in dosbox, im useing version .61 so it might not work in other versions. The game doesnt have any new music except those three midis you see in the file, so you'll have to play them externally if you want to listen while you play.

content:

title: Re: keen 7 mod!
content:
Music was off, and sound was played through the internal speaker by default.
Basically you're using the settings as they were when the ZIP was made, not the settings like how you set them from your own/original/clean Keen 4 copy.
Don't forget to change that... although you'll get K4 audio, since that isn't moddable (yet).Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

Just played through 7-8 of your levels.. I have to say, this is really impressive. Comprehensive artwork, keenish level structures. Great use of tiles. Colours blend in perfectly. You cast a huge challenge for others who end up modding keens 4-6. Ten points to your team [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
Thanks for the help guys, I was using Dosbox 6.3, so I downloaded 6.5 and it works perfectly. Awesome work so far! I'm especially looking forward to your next releases with music and all that!

title: nice job
content: Nice! I really enjoyed it but what does this mean for the future of modding Keens 1-3. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-deadkeenvort.gif[/img]

title: hehe
content:
Modding Keen1-3 is similar to preparing a box of Macaroni and Cheese. It's a daunting task at first, if you've never cooked anything before, period--but the instructions are simple, the tools are ample, and there's not too much that can go horribly wrong. This is something that can theoretically be done in a week or two (*cough LevelLord cough*) or take several years (*cough Spleen and KeenRush cough*)... It's something that goes down easy every time, and isn't tough to prepare... I suspect it'll stick around for a long time.

Modding Keen4-6 is more akin to setting down a seven course meal with dessert. The amount of graphics work alone is roughly 8 times the size of the first trilogy, and then the addition of music, 3 layers of level design, 3 difficulties, new story screens, more complex enemy behaviors and characteristics... and the whole thing is played more by ear at this point. With the box of macaroni and cheese, you can add spices here and there, or mix in a few additional ingredients, but you're still following a basic recipe. This seven course meal doesn't have nearly as much documentation (yet).

I'm still incredibly impressed with Ceilick's first showing, here. There's a balance and flow to the level design, and each of the changed enemies matches their environment nicely. The mod truly feels like a complete package, rather than a level pack with an altered tileset. He's laid the groundwork for future releases, as well as set the bar of expectation rather high.

Congrats on a successful release, Ceilick! This is neat!

Edit: Mis-spelled 'dessert' as 'desert.'[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: hehe
content:
Yeah, I don't see that this would harm Keen 1-3 modding or such. Naturally it can (hopefully) make more people realize that Keen 4-6 mods actually can be done, and start working on them, but it can also make them think that "gaaarg, it'd take a mortzillion years for me to make one!!" and turn them into Keen 1-3 modding instead.. Both are fine for me. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-drool.gif[/img] (And it's highly unlikely anyone'll see a Keen 4 mod by me for a long time..)3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

Woah! I was blasted away by this excelent mod! Just want to thank you! You're a great modder!

update: Now I've just found an interesting bug. It's located at the Underground level. When the level appears on the map, go through it, but don't enter. Just move up and right constantly. When the level dissapear, you've should be able to walk outside the normal walkable area [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] . If you want to return back, go to the Gem Temple. Note that you should be finished the blocking level to the mushroom first, if you don't want to stuck.

Notice that there are a few more texts that needed to be replaced. For example when Keen dies and it tells you to return to the shadowlands (?!?). Or the text when exiting the game in DOS. And maybe somewhere in the help menu I've noticed Keen 4 related texts.----

title: hmm
content:
That raises an interesting question, since Keen4-6 have the difficulty settings. Ceilick, how did you design all these levels? My first instinct would be to do the whole thing with a "Normal" mindset, and then add or subtract stuff after the fact to make "Easy" and "Hard." ....But the more I think about it, the more I'd want to just start the whole thing with "Hard" in mind, and then subtract some/more to make the "Normal" and "Easy" settings.

How did you do it?

title: Re: hmm
content:
Glad that you guys like it, and I'd love to hear feedback along the lines of what I can improve for my next keen mod (keen6).

A lot of stuff is still difficult to edit as far as the opening screen and certain texts in the game. Keen 4-6 doesnt have all the usefull patches and tools like keen 1-3. Interesting bug with the underground though! I found one similar to the right of the Gem temple.

With the levels, I designed them to be played on Hard mode. Experienced keen players should be playing on this skill. Easy and normal mode should only be played by inexperienced players. Even on easy though, I've watched people play that cant beat the first level [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: congrats
content:
Well I've finally finished the game on medium with total score of 763 000 and 30 lives.

I want to share some more thoughts about the game.
Maybe it's something you were looking for, but I've never managed to collect more than 50 ammo through the game. The guns are always rare and this is something not really typical for the Keen universe. I mean I've always managed to finished Keen 4, 5 and 6 with much more than 99 ammos. If you don't want the player to get full of ammo maybe you should put some guns in the secret areas. There are many secrets in your game but none of them contains ammo. Btw placing most of the time 100 points candys in the secret areas isn't really a big deal. Most of the secrets in original keens contains bigger score candys which motivates the player to search more for secrets. Otherwise finding those secrests or not won't affect much your overall final score.
Finding the secret level was really difficult, although I've read the sign. That was the only one time I've used cheats though.
The design of the enemyes is awesome. My favorites are magifly (that with the flying carpet - insane idea!), rotten raddish, patsy (pretty neat replacement of the slug), nosdril and, of course, ogobogo. This turtle is a wothy heir. Well now we have a second-dumbest turtle in the universe [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img] .
The overall difficulty of the game, by playing on medium, was ok. The first few levels were easy, the most were medium and a few were hard.
It's quite clear that all the levels were tested, so I don't found any major bugs. There were some glitches with the pole climbing of some of them though. While player jumps up and move through a foreground tile, he stops. But that doesn't really affect the game because you can just climb up without jumping.
I enjoyed the story, which imo is quite keenish. And especially the end. I was like "eeh what?".
So thanx again for this game. I didn't enjoyed a game like this for a long time. Yeah, Keen is Keen (whatever they said).
Looking forward for any news on the next episode. GL.----

[img]http://img294.imageshack.us/img294/1923/untitled116qa.gif[/img]
Tough Bloogs eat princesses

title: stuck

Just how to get out of it? I can't seem to find the exit. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-rollhead.gif[/img]

keeners!

title: Re: stuck
content:
DaVince21: Thanks! If you or anyone else for that matter have any cool ideas or improvements I'd like to hear what i can do better (theres a topic for it in the modding forum).

Johnkbutler: There are two exits to the fun house: the normal exit and the secret exit.

To get to the normal exit, you'll have to go to the bottom left corner, ride the elevator to the right where you will flip a switch. Then return to the left on the elevator. Go up and you will see a bridge of above the picture of the red blob (blorb). Cross the bridge and go through the red door which should lead to the exit.

To get to the secret exit, follow the same path to the bottom right corner. You'll have to look around a bit to find it though.

Good Luck! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

title: Re: stuck
content: I particularly like the way you've used the schoolfish (I assume) as birds that follow Keen in the normal levels.  I like it when things like that are used in quite different ways to the original game.

But it was a real challenge to make the enemies look entirely differant, especialy since their behaviours are so specific. I think managed it farely well except for maybe the inchworm.

title: Critique
content:
I just played some more (after more or less forgetting I still needed to finish this), and figured I'd better read the notes I wrote and write some comments about the mod.
It's a critical post, but those are usually the most helpful, as long as it's clear what the solutions to the "problems" are.

Firstly, I'm playing at the Normal difficulty level, and I'm currently at the Forest Skies level, but finished everything else up until there, minus whatever is in the water where Keen says he needs a coin for some reason.
(On an unrelated note, I discovered I really aren't fluid in SGA anymore.)

I have to say I think this mod is a bit too hard, for my tastes anyway.
I try to get all the points, and some of those really are pretty hard, making it neccessary to Save, Load, fail, Load, fail, Load, fail, Load, succeed, Save, go on on some occassions.

That also made me realise Keen's interface basically sucks now that I got used to better.
I use my original Gravis PC GamePad to play, and for some reason scrolling through the menus with the D-pad doesn't work, it usually skips a bunch of options after only a split second press, the buttons don't always do what you expect, nor do Enter and Escape, not to mention the fact that you don't return to the game after saving, and so on, making this way too much of a hassle.
I didn't really have this problem with the original games, since they weren't as hard, and didn't need the menu as much.
I actually got annoyed by this this evening. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

There were some levels with those bouncing things (not in levels I played recently, don't remember, but mushroom replacements) right in front of sliding poles.
Getting all the items, also on top of these poles, also requires perfect timing and usually some saving and loading.

There are some typos and textual mistakes I noticed.
For instance Keen says: "I wonder where the rest of the keys are?"
I'm not sure why, but I see lots of people write question marks after sentences including verbs like "to wonder" and "to guess", even though they aren't really questions.
Anyway, just nitpicking here.

The secrets are a bit obvious.
Due to the way the "camera" looks at the levels, secrets are usually in the ceiling or in the right wall.
Everytime I suspected a secret, there was in fact a secret.
Well, not everytime, but a lot of times, so maybe it's just that there are a lot of secrets compared to the original?
Less secrets would mean I wouldn't look for them as much, making them more special... I think.

The switches aren't marked with signs with letters (or anything), making it impossible to see which devices they correspond with.
This is a design choice of course, but all Keen games had signs, and I like them.

Already mentioned, but the music doesn't work in some levels due to memory problems.
Since the music is Keen 4 music, and this isn't Keen 4, that's OK.
However I also found a level (maybe more) where I actually had to turn of the sound to be able to load it.
That's a bit of a shame, I'd personally try to remove some enemies or something to make the engine support all levels properly.

I shot one of those drill worm thingies (Wormouth replacement) and it's stunned head fell down a platform. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
I actually paid attention to this in Keen 4 because I wanted to do this in the past, but all platforms with Wormouths have ridges to make this impossible to happen.
It looks weird, since it's just a head.
Anyway, hardly a bug, but I felt like mentioning it anyway. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

In the level Mansion, I think near the yellow keyhole (a while since I wrote my notes), there is a secret which is right next to some of your pipes (not sure what they are exactly), which are walk-through.
I exited the secret room and ended up behind those pipes... pretty sure that wasn't your intention.

Finally I also noticed something that's been mentioned by somebody else by now, the sliding poles.
I usually don't climb the entire way, but jump up, grab the pole again, jump up some more, and repeat.
Once you get the timing right, this makes ascending a lot faster.
On your poles I sometimes hit my head on... nothing... or something...
It made me have to just do the slow climbing thing.

OK, that concludes my post.
Again, I do like the mod, really I do, even if I'm being critical. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: the reply
content:
Iv4n: I've already made some progress with keen 6, I havent tried editing levels yet, only importing graphics, but it seems to work fine.

Retodon8: I was actualy told by my testers that the mod was too easy, but maybe you had a harder time because of the gamepad? I'll defintaly work on spacing out the secrets more and having less. I cant believe I forgot to make signs for the switches!! I really should have remebered these, although if you notice I think the types of switch correspond with the type of platform they activate (the up-down lever activates elevators, the twist lever activates bridges). Im really not sure what the sliding pole issue is, but I'll try to work it out in my next mod. Thanks for the info, glad you liked it. And no, your not being too critical at all [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

Johnkbutler: If you read in the help manual (the txt file found with the other game folders, its titled "Commander Keen Episode 7 Hints Sheet") it gives a hint on how to pass that point.

Everyone: Im pretty sure I said it before, and Levelass is right, I tried to import new songs but it didnt work. Rather than limit the amount and variety of enemies I could put in a level I just decided to turn the in-game music off. Keenrush made some great midi's that you can play externaly though.

title: Re: the reply

title: Re: music
content:
I tried to import new songs but it didnt work. Rather than limit the amount and variety of enemies I could put in a level I just decided to turn the in-game music off

What was the problem when you tried to import the music? Were the files too big? How did you create them? If they were too large, you could try running them through the IMF optimiser I wrote a few years back, it removes any unnecessary codes from the IMFs and ends up making most IMF files less than half their original size, without changing the way they sound.

title: Re: pogo
content: when you pogo, run right, activate pogo at the edge but dont hit jump, then hit pogo again as you're flying through the air and you should be able to grab the ledge.

title: Re: Critique
content:
I have to admit I didn't really play around with my memory settings, but the regular Keen episodes just work without the need for any tweaking, so this mod does take a bit more memory.
I didn't do anything "wrong".
I also had a level where the music turned itself of with that message, but there's at least one level that exited rightaway with a memory message.

Anyway, apparently tweaking by either turning off stuff of scraping together some more memory works, so it's not a big deal.
Also like Malv said, not having music wasn't bad, since I have those songs "connected" to Keen 4, and it's sort of akward to hear them in similar-but-other environments.
(I played on my old computer, I only tried one level or so earlier on my more modern computer, with DOSBox, and I think (don't know) I had memory issues there, but again, did no tweaking.)

Yep, there's always Easy.
I'm just saying this mod seems to be overall more difficult than Keen 4, since I have less problems playing that on Normal.
I played it on Hard a while ago, also tried to get all the items, and remember there being less hazards in places making harder to do that.
I'm better with gamepad than with keyboard.
Maybe it's just me, I never really play Keen anymore these days.
Also maybe I was just more in the mood for some mindless fun, not so much in the mood for doing my best... it happens.

The interface doesn't suck for me, it just sucks, period. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
(It didn't back then, but us gamers got spoiled over time, not just with graphics.)
Luckily these days in modern games things are a lot easier to work with.

I noticed the different switches, didn't realise I could tell what they did just by looking, which tells us I wasn't very perceptive apparently. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] Retodon8
Sheep happens! [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Keen/Graphics/K1_nme_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

Otherwise there'd be more of them and they'd hopefully be a lot better. title: Re:
content:
For some reason I couldn't get the Keen4/5/6 feel with this mod. It has some interesting sprite graphics, but many tiles look like they're just recolored Keen4 graphics. And the water levels... well, they aren't as amazing as the Well of Wishes. Those little red guys are really annoying, but I think that's because I hate the Pyramid of the Gnosticene Ancients. Other graphics are very similar to Keen 3 (for example, the Manor level backgrounds).

EDIT: I almost forgot to mention, the Krodacian sprite graphics are awesome![hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

title: Re: im curious
content:
Wow, they weren't recolored graphics. I realized that after taking a closer look to a screenshot. One modded tile looks like 4x4 original tiles.

About the water levels, I think they're... different. Perhaps it's me, or Keen4/5/6 are too perfect to be MODded, while the original I. of the Vorticons series obviously didn't take advantage of the game engine, making it possible to create incredibly excellent mods (i.e. KeenX and KeenNull). K. of Krodacia is an excellent mod anyway. It has some funny bugs, though. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

In Slime Lake, in the pole under the last switch underground, there's a bug. If I climb the pole jumping all the time, I get stuck in the roof. It doesn't happen if I climb the pole without jumping. Why is that?[hr]
"Eat your veggies!"

title: Re: commander keen
content:
Hello,

I downloaded this unofficial Keen 7 and first thing I can say is - wow, what a great job! How much time ceilick had to spend working on this!

I've finished the whole game (few days ago), all levels passed with the score of 713.500. What do you think of this?

Althrough the whole game was based on CK4, you (ceilick) used the maximum of that episode to create something new.

Now a little review. Let's see.

Pros:
1. I love the way you use all the creatures from CK4, especially slugs and council members. This is a complete success!
2. The idea of collecting keys and green gems.
3. The levels are mostly designed creativly, in Keenish style. I love the details, such as "Wash your hands" sins.
4. The story. You did every single detail. The ending is nice too.
5. The overal impression is very good.

Cons:
1. The music. Althrough I like the music from CK4, I rather disliked the music in CK7, because of the fact you used the same tune (form CK4 pyramids) in most levels. It was tiring to listen to this nth time. I also think it would be hard to produce some nice, good fitting new Keen music (I don't like the .mid tunes you attached).
2. The hidden points. Like someone said, it was too simple to find many of the hidden goods, and mostly it was 100 or 200 point items. You can't find things like that in original games.
Also - there was a little bit too many of them.
3. The spaceship from The Fun House took me too the middle of forest. Only "No clipping" cheat helped me to get to the secret level. I don't know if I had a most recent version, if yes, this is alsolutely the biggest bug it can be!
4. Finding way to secret level required me reading your posts (or hints file) and using god mode a little bit. It was hard, but in CK4 and CK5 it was exteremely difficult too. I don't know if this feature is really a disadventage.
5.This is just my opinon, but I disliked the colors used in maps and creatures. They are too contrasting. In CK4-CK6 I would say the colors were more fitting themselves.
6. On the windo shown after not passing the level there is an option "Exit to shadowlands", it should be "Exit to Krodacia".
7. The place near red gem in Gem Temple. No situation like this in original series happened. And remember that not everyone reads the attached text files [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img]
However, I figured it myself [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] But after loading game-killing-loading game many, many times.
8. Some other hard to pass places, like the situation in the Mushroom Forest, when you must collect gem hidden near that creature (I forget the name). And the "turtle-areas" in underwater levels - they were very, very hard to pass.

Conclusion:
Althrough I mentioned more cons than pros, this is simply the best unofficial episode for me. The pros heavily overweight the disadventages.
Thanks for creating Keys of Krodacia. And I hope someone (maybe you?) will do the unofficial CK8. After I've read about the fact you work on the CK6 mod as the next episode, I was very excited! And today morning I read about your refusing... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-offended.gif[/img]

title: Re: commander keen
content:
I'll add my two kopeks to this discussion... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-disguised.gif[/img]

I only recently found this for the first time, and was pleasantly surprised. The fact that it was a complete Keen 4 mod was so exciting that I went to the trouble of transferring the game to my old Win95 laptop, which will run Keen the right way.

I personally thought Keys of Krodacia was phenomenal. The characters were all very original and interesting, and I liked the contrast in the game between the natural environments (ie the forests), the ancient buildings, and the modern structures. Furthermore, I know what a pain in the arse TEDEDIT can be to use, so I commend you for making so many complex levels with it. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

My complaints are all minor and don't really detract from the playability of the game. I just want to say that the mushroom replacements got me several times because they were too reminiscent of bounders. Nothing serious, but thought I'd point it out. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-dopekeen.gif[/img] [img]http://i91.photobucket.com/albums/k284/KeegTech/WarholDopefishPNG2.png[/img]

title: Re: commander keen
content:
This was a nice mod, probably the best one I ever played for any keen episode.


It felt a little like you ran out of ideas for levels toward the end. Maybe it's just because the beginning ones were so cool. ('Course, for all I know, you could have made those last and had just gotten better at making levels as you went along!)

Anyway, good work. I am very impressed.

title: Re: commander keen
content:
Szymon Bartus: Im really glad you liked it, its comments like these that make me want to make more mods. But unfortunately, I dont have the time or the will to get through another keen project again [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

Keen enemies has always been my favorite part of modding, so Im really glad you like my new enemies.

As far as music goes, I had a lot of trouble importing new songs into the game, so I released with the intent that people would play without music. I had no idea that every level had the pyramids music.

I dont know what the deal with the spaceship is, it should take you to the secret level and after the secret level back to the main path on the map.

Im not quite sure what you mean by the colors, but in general I tried to use color schemes that were not used in keen 4-6.

Thanks for the detailed review, and I really am sorry that I wont be finishing the series.

Keegtech: glad you enjoyed it. I actually used z-ones keen 4-6 level editor, which is much easier to use than ted5 (which I never got to work at all).

Feldegryph: Glad you liked it. It was awhile ago since I did this, but Im pretty sure I was running out of ideas toward the end with some of the levels.
